page.title: 03WORK OPPORTUNITIES
page.content: Blackrod was an old mining village. At the end of the nineteenth century most of the men of Blackrod were { {miners,}but by 1938 all the {mines } were closed. The main road today is the one built alongside the mines for transporting {coal.} Most{industry }now is on a small scale. There are small{engineering, {chemical and haulage }firms. The average number of people employed in these firms is{7.} The only large employer is { {Littlewood's Mail Order.}In 1983 Â£7 500 000 was spent there on mechanisation and computerisation. { {Littlewood's }employs{300}people, mostly part-time females,who provide a flexible work force because they can work overtime during busy periods. All the men work full-time.
